examples: He reached over and turned off his bedside light.
Jill must have been in another world when I asked her to turn off the oven because the bread is burned now.
"Turn off?"
Turn off.
Once inside, he turned off the security alarm.
words.defineEn: to cause a machine, device, or equipment to stop operating, typically by pushing a button or turning a key
words.defineVi: làm cho máy móc, thiết bị hoặc thiết bị ngừng hoạt động, thường bằng cách nhấn nút hoặc vặn chìa khóa

examples: Come on!
Come on, Bill.
C'm on, kids!
Come on in and make yourself at home.
Come on, let's get it over with.
words.defineEn: used for encouraging someone to hurry
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để khuyến khích ai đó nhanh lên

examples: Then switch off read receipts.
Others fire rapidly in short bursts before switching off, or remain quiet for long periods until thousands of inputs from other neurons line up in just the right way.
That makes for killer night vision, but in bright light, those rods become overloaded and can switch off completely.
That was the first one that's told us to turn the power supply switch off.
After weaning they switch off the gene that allows them to digest milk.
words.defineEn: to make something stop working usually by flipping a switch
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó ngừng hoạt động thường bằng cách bật công tắc

examples: The wedding ceremony went off without a hitch.
No wonder some people went off the rails a bit.
The fire alarm went off, and we evacuated the building.
She went off on a tangent about what happened to her last summer.
My dad went off the deep end when he found out what I'd done.
words.defineEn: (of a gun, bomb, etc.) to be fired or to explode
words.defineVi: (của súng, bom, v.v.) được bắn hoặc phát nổ

examples: The moments around Gaddafi's death were also caught on camera.
It catches on the sides of your cheek.
- You've caught on.
Over time, hardware gimmicks and accessories didn't catch on.
Didn't catch on, unfortunately.
words.defineEn: to become popular or trendy
words.defineVi: để trở nên phổ biến hoặc hợp thời trang

examples: Susan has a keen eye for detail, so each dress is beautifully finished off.
Again, finished off with that tarka and this habanero oil that I make.
We finished off the last video entering into the Great Depression.
And then he can finish off by turning around completely.
All that's finished off by 64 gigabytes of RAM, a two terabyte NVMe SSD for boot, a four terabyte SSD for storage and a six terabyte hard drive for less faster storage.
words.defineEn: to complete or finalize something, especially in a successful or satisfying manner
words.defineVi: để hoàn thành hoặc kết thúc một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là trong một cách thành công hoặc thỏa mãn

words.defineEn: to cause something to happen, particularly an unpleasant one
words.defineVi: để gây ra một cái gì đó xảy ra, đặc biệt là một khó chịu

examples: - I can log off, kid.
The best way to navigate this hyper-targeted media environment would be to, well, log off.
words.defineEn: to disconnect or sign out of a computer system or online account
words.defineVi: để ngắt kết nối hoặc đăng xuất khỏi hệ thống máy tính hoặc tài khoản trực tuyến

examples: I put on a clean pair of socks every morning.
He's just putting on an act for the boss's benefit.
He put on his leather jacket before heading out on his motorcycle.
He was always putting on airs and graces.
She put on her swimsuit and jumped into the pool.
words.defineEn: to put a piece of clothing on one's or someone else's body
words.defineVi: để đặt một mảnh quần áo trên cơ thể của một người hoặc người khác

examples: John finally paid off his credit card debt and felt a huge weight lifted off his shoulders.
The student worked multiple jobs to pay off her student loans, acknowledging that debt is the worst poverty.
I think if we invest in this project, it will pay off over the long run.
We've had to dig into our saving to pay off the debt.
After paying off my credit card, I am in credit by $500.
words.defineEn: (of a plan or action) to succeed and have good results
words.defineVi: (của một kế hoạch hoặc hành động) để thành công và có kết quả tốt

examples: I had lost my job and my wife, and I didn't know how I would carry on.
You make me as mad as a hornet with the way you carry on sometimes, you know that?
I carry on, more concurrent conversations.
So carry on.
Alright, carry on.
words.defineEn: to take part in an activity
words.defineVi: tham gia vào một hoạt động

examples: The war continued to drag on indecisively.
As Bezos's virtual blockade dragged on for months.
The legal cases could potentially drag on for weeks or even longer.
Over time, this effect drags on the planet's spin, fixing one side to orbit the star.
The great recession dragged on box demand and even after the recession demand continued to slow for consumer goods like soda and for the boxes that transport them.
words.defineEn: to continue for longer than necessary or desirable
words.defineVi: để tiếp tục lâu hơn mức cần thiết hoặc mong muốn

examples: Life goes on.
This dictionary goes on the top shelf.
The show must go on!
My family goes on a vacation once a year.
Shares went on sale this morning.
words.defineEn: to continue without stopping
words.defineVi: tiếp tục mà không dừng lại

examples: And we're going to cheer on our brave senators, and congress men and women.
Claimed they cheered on 9/11
Heather Williams was usually the loudest mom cheering on the sidelines for her kids' sports games.
When she wasn't on the track, she was on the sidelines, cheering on her five boys and grandchildren in the same sport.
So, I do have a soft spot for really boosting the esteem and cheering on my women friends.
words.defineEn: to shout encouragement or express enthusiastic support for someone or something, typically during a performance, competition, or challenging situation
words.defineVi: để hét lên khích lệ hoặc bày tỏ sự ủng hộ nhiệt tình cho ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó, điển hình là trong một buổi biểu diễn, cuộc thi hoặc tình huống thử thách

words.defineEn: used to dismiss someone's unrealistic or far-fetched idea or suggestion, indicating that it is unlikely or impossible to happen
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để bác bỏ ý tưởng hoặc đề xuất không thực tế hoặc xa vời của ai đó, cho thấy rằng điều đó khó xảy ra hoặc không thể xảy ra

words.defineEn: to continue doing something with determination and make progress without delay or distraction
words.defineVi: để tiếp tục làm điều gì đó với quyết tâm và tiến bộ mà không chậm trễ hoặc phân tâm

words.defineEn: to cancel or postpone a match or game due to heavy rain or unfavorable weather conditions
words.defineVi: để hủy bỏ hoặc hoãn một trận đấu hoặc trò chơi do mưa lớn hoặc điều kiện thời tiết không thuận lợi

examples: It may take some time for the medication to wear off.
Does the potency wear off at some point?
It wears off fast.
This wore off not long after the outbreak.
By the next morning, the effect has mostly worn off, but Anja still has questions.
words.defineEn: to gradually fade or disappear, especially with regards to color or a material's quality, due to continuous use or exposure to external factors
words.defineVi: phai dần hoặc biến mất, đặc biệt là về màu sắc hoặc chất lượng của vật liệu, do sử dụng liên tục hoặc tiếp xúc với các yếu tố bên ngoài

examples: I haven't lost my job yet, but the writing is on the wall: my company just laid off 50 more people today.
The government turned its back to the thousands of employees laid off during the financial crisis.
She had a great job with a supportive team, but eventually the company downsized and she was laid off.
The company was determined to increase profits by hook or by crook, even if it meant laying off some employees.
John was having a bad day when his car broke down, and then he found out he'd been laid off from work as well.
words.defineEn: to stop doing an activity
words.defineVi: ngừng thực hiện một hoạt động

examples: he broke off a piece of his chocolate.
Break off the nipple.
Won't even break off.
Crabbers can legally break off both claws if they meet the required size.
A rare group of scorpions will sometimes break off their tails to escape predators.
words.defineEn: to suddenly stop or discontinue something that was previously happening, particularly a conversation or an action, before it is completed
words.defineVi: đột ngột dừng lại hoặc chấm dứt điều gì đó đang xảy ra trước đó, đặc biệt là một cuộc trò chuyện hoặc một hành động, trước khi nó được hoàn thành

examples: Trump calls off the dogs in response.
Management urged cabin crew to call off their work to rule.
There was an eleventh-hour decision by the union to call off the strike.
Staff had been calling off because they were sick.
The study was supposed to last for 2 weeks but was actually called off after just 6 days because the conditions in the prison went downhill so quickly.
words.defineEn: to cancel what has been planned
words.defineVi: để hủy bỏ những gì đã được lên kế hoạch

examples: Narrator: Ship-breakers saw off massive sections of the hull and move them overhead.
And this is exactly what fish researchers saw off the coast of Saudi Arabia in May 2018.
In a Q1 2021 earnings call, Darden Restaurants CEO Eugene Lee said Olive Garden saw off premise sales increase 123% in the first quarter making up 45% of total sales.
words.defineEn: to accompany someone to their point of departure and say goodbye to them
words.defineVi: đi cùng ai đó đến điểm khởi hành của họ và nói lời tạm biệt với họ

examples: The car ran off the road into a ditch.
Tom runs off at the mouth too much.
We are run off our feet trying to fill orders.
As soon as he saw the policeman, he ran off like a scalded cat.
I know the feeling, I wanted to come to your event last Tuesday and simply got run off my feet.
words.defineEn: to leave a situation or location in a sudden manner
words.defineVi: để rời khỏi một tình huống hoặc địa điểm một cách đột ngột

words.defineEn: to approach or move towards someone or something quietly, carefully, and usually without being noticed
words.defineVi: tiếp cận hoặc di chuyển về phía ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó lặng lẽ, cẩn thận và thường không được chú ý

examples: The team was on the verge of winning the championship, but as they say, there is many a slip twixt cup and lip, and they ultimately lost the game due to a last-minute mistake.
Her husband's violent and abusive behavior drove her to the verge of despair.
The sharks have been circling for so long that I don't really remember what it's like to not be on the verge of bankruptcy.
Agreed to suspend a loan they had been on the verge of sending to Peking, and promised to hold back in future until they saw which way the cat jumped.
The company is on the verge of bankruptcy.
words.defineEn: to be on the edge or border of something
words.defineVi: được trên các cạnh hoặc biên giới của một cái gì đó

examples: We quickly called the dogs off and backed off ourselves.
The press backed off and the Congress all but cleared him of wrongdoing.
He seems to back off sometimes.
You're my O.B I want to back off right now.
And so in the third presidential debate of 2012, Mitt Romney lost that debate, in my opinion, to Barack Obama because he backed off.
words.defineEn: to move away or retreat from a person or situation
words.defineVi: di chuyển ra xa hoặc rút lui khỏi một người hoặc tình huống

examples: Technology advances by fits and starts.
The study yielded significant findings that could advance medical research.
She booked a hotel room in advance to ensure she had a place to stay during her vacation.
The tennis player achieved a clean sweep of her matches, winning every set and advancing to the finals.
I lived on the edge using cash advances to pay one credit card with another until I finally found a job three months after graduation.
words.defineEn: to cause to move forward or to progress
words.defineVi: để gây ra để di chuyển về phía trước hoặc để tiến bộ

examples: He scares off other males of his species by flashing a bright patch of color on his clubs, called a meral patch.
So they only use it to scare off their enemies.
I’d look really big, and I could probably scare off whatever was scaring me.
But, aside from that one exception, we’re the only mammal that isn’t scared off by that burning sensation.
Birds use them to steer through the air, and rattlesnakes use them to scare off predators.
words.defineEn: to frighten someone or something away so that they do not come closer or continue with their intended action
words.defineVi: sợ hãi ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó đi để họ không đến gần hơn hoặc tiếp tục với hành động dự định của họ

examples: Remember, never put off until tomorrow what you can do today!
It's pointless to put off what can be wrapped up today until tomorrow.
There's no point in putting off what can be done today until tomorrow.
One shall never put off what one can do today till tomorrow.
Jamie always tends to put off today's work till tomorrow, but that ends tonight.
words.defineEn: to postpone or cancel something such as an appointment or arrangement
words.defineVi: để trì hoãn hoặc hủy bỏ một cái gì đó như một cuộc hẹn hoặc sắp xếp

examples: When one member of the group started making fun of a classmate, it wasn't long before others joined in.
- So join in.
- So join in.
So join in.
- So join in.
words.defineEn: to take part in an activity or event that others are already engaged in
words.defineVi: tham gia vào một hoạt động hoặc sự kiện mà những người khác đã tham gia

examples: The team's success is built on the meat and potatoes of hard work and dedication.
They're going to build on the site of the old power station.

Contractors have started building on waste land near the town.
This new research builds on a different strategy.
words.defineEn: to use something as a foundation or basis for further development or expansion
words.defineVi: để sử dụng một cái gì đó làm nền tảng hoặc cơ sở để phát triển hoặc mở rộng hơn nữa

words.defineEn: to come close to or almost reach a particular level, quality, or state
words.defineVi: đến gần hoặc gần như đạt đến một mức độ, chất lượng hoặc trạng thái cụ thể

examples: - You cordon off this field and try to surround it, even when we have a canine assist come in so that the dog can follow and smell the people, he gets overloaded.
words.defineEn: to put up a barrier or boundary around an area, often for security or safety reasons, to prevent people from entering or leaving that area
words.defineVi: dựng rào chắn hoặc ranh giới xung quanh một khu vực, thường vì lý do an ninh hoặc an toàn, để ngăn mọi người ra vào khu vực đó

words.defineEn: to close a place or area to prevent people from entering or leaving
words.defineVi: để đóng một địa điểm hoặc khu vực để ngăn chặn người vào hoặc ra

words.defineEn: to include or attach something to an existing thing, usually with the intention of increasing its value, functionality, or capacity
words.defineVi: để bao gồm hoặc đính kèm một cái gì đó vào một thứ hiện có, thường là với mục đích tăng giá trị, chức năng hoặc khả năng của nó

words.defineEn: to separate or divide a large space into smaller sections using a partition or divider
words.defineVi: để tách hoặc chia một không gian lớn thành các phần nhỏ hơn bằng cách sử dụng phân vùng hoặc dải phân cách

examples: Its characters are painted in broad brushstrokes.
The crime was committed in broad daylight.
Stolen goods are sold unashamedly in broad daylight
Traveling to a foreign country allowed me to see my own culture and values in a new light, gaining a broader perspective and appreciation for diversity.
Karen has broad shoulders sure, but she can't endure endless criticism.
words.defineEn: having a large distance between one side and another
words.defineVi: có một khoảng cách lớn giữa bên này và bên kia

examples: On his wedding day, he looked like a million dollars in his tailored tuxedo and beaming smile.
words.defineEn: filled with a sense of joy or happiness, often to the point of appearing to glow
words.defineVi: tràn đầy cảm giác vui vẻ hoặc hạnh phúc, thường đến mức dường như phát sáng

examples: Both men wore confident smiles.
She smiled nervously.
She had a big smile on her face.
The old gentleman greeted everyone with a warm smile.
His wife smiled, recalling the old saying that a man is a lion in his own cause.
words.defineEn: an expression in which our mouth curves upwards, when we are being friendly or are happy or amused
words.defineVi: một biểu hiện mà miệng của chúng ta cong lên, khi chúng ta thân thiện hoặc vui vẻ hoặc thích thú

examples: She grimaced at the taste of the bitter medicine.
The child grimaced in pain as the doctor examined his injured arm.
As the comedian told the joke, the audience grimaced in a mixture of amusement and discomfort.
The teacher's stern grimace warned the students to behave.
She couldn't hide her grimace of disgust when she tasted the spoiled milk.
words.defineEn: a twisted facial expression indicating pain, disgust or disapproval
words.defineVi: nét mặt vặn vẹo thể hiện sự đau đớn, ghê tởm hoặc không tán thành

examples: The diamond thief double-crossed his partners and gave them only worthless fake jewels.
The thug threw dust in her eyes and exchanged her real diamonds with fake stones.
He played a trick on his sister by putting a fake spider in her bed.
The fake article had been in print in the renowned scientific journal for more than a week before its author revealed that he had pulled a stunt.
The fake article had been in print in the renowned scientific journal for more than a week before its author revealed that he had pulled a fast one.
words.defineEn: intentionally misleading or deceptive
words.defineVi: cố ý gây hiểu nhầm hoặc lừa đảo

examples: She stayed tight-lipped and shook her head.
He's been very tight-lipped about what happened at the meeting.
He's very tight-lipped I kinda like this.
words.defineEn: unwilling to speak freely or disclose information
words.defineVi: không muốn nói chuyện tự do hoặc tiết lộ thông tin

examples: That should wipe the grin off his face.
She just grins and bears it all.
There he was, grinning like the Cheshire cat
He grinned, and then checked himself, not wanting to upset Jack.
Charles was sitting in his place, grinning like a Cheshire cat, when I joined him.
words.defineEn: a broad smile that reveals the teeth
words.defineVi: một nụ cười rộng để lộ răng

examples: Wipe that smirk off your face, you little punk.
- Look at that stupid smirk on his face.
Now the truth, is Joe smirked because he could relate to my desire to go on vacation.
I think what was that smirk all about?
What do you keep smirking for?
words.defineEn: a half-smile that can indicate satisfaction, superiority, or amusement
words.defineVi: một nụ cười nửa miệng có thể biểu thị sự hài lòng, vượt trội hoặc thích thú
